claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling that primes tumors for improved response to immune checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely, and mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination induces a broader peptide repertoire display on MHC-I, enhancing tumor visibility to T cells and increasing CD8+ T-cell infiltration.

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape
Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination increases PD-L1 expression in tumor tissue, making the checkpoint axis more targetable and creating a biological rationale for combination with anti-PD-L1 therapy.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x | 1.0x | Checkpoint axis became more targetable
PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation from the retrospective human data.

claims.claim: Patients with prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination showed improved survival under ICI treatment compared to unvaccinated patients in retrospective analysis.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.caveat: The retrospective design means residual confounding is likely, vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients, and tumor-type heterogeneity limits causal inference.

claims.claim: The combination of intratumoral mRNA vaccination with anti-PD-L1 checkpoint blockade improves tumor control in preclinical models.

evidence.quote: Mouse efficacy cohort (combination therapy): 78 tumor-bearing mice pooled across repeat experiments.
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors, and prospective randomized studies are required before clinical protocol changes are justified.
